oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Martha White Show - Lester Flatt and the Nashville Grass - 1977-05-06 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Multiple recordings of two Martha White Shows, featuring Grant Turner (host), Lester Flatt (host/performer), Kenny Ingram (performer), Benny Martin (performer), the Nashville Grass (performers), special guest John Hartford (performer) and featured record excerpts from Mel Besher, Curly Seckler, the Carl Tipton Band, and Raymond Fairchild on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) First recording is from May 6, 1977 and second recording is from August 4, 1977. End of tape also features two vocal performances by Grant Turner.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Nashville Grass; Kenny Ingram; Lester Flatt; Benny Martin; John Hartford; Mel Besher; Curly Seckler; Carl Tipton Band; Raymond Fairchild; Grant Turner
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Grant Turner introduces Lester Flatt -- Lester Flatt introduces himself -- Farewell Blues (Kenny Ingram) -- Martha White commercial -- (Grant Turner and Lester Flatt) -- Pig In A Pen (Benny Martin) -- Lester talks about their playing and fishing together -- Jesus Gold (Lester Flatt) -- Martha White commercial (Grant Turner) -- Lester Flatt introduces John Hartford -- Sitting On Top Of The World (John Hartford) -- Lester Flatt talks about his playing -- Closing statement (Lester Flatt) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Grant Turner) -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Sidewalk Ballerina (Mel Besher) [record excerpt] -- Grant Turner talks about Mel Besher, Jimmy Martin, and the rest of the group -- Martha White commercial (Grant Turner) -- China Grove, My Home Town (Curly Seckler) [record excerpt] -- Grant Turner talks about Charlie Louvin's upcoming shows -- Slippers With Wings (Carl Tipton Band) [record excerpt] -- Martha White commercial (Grant Turner) -- Clinch Mountain Backstep (Raymond Fairchild) [record excerpt] -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Grant Turner) -- One Step In The Darkness, One Step In The Sun (Grant Turner vocals) -- No One To Hold Your Hand (Grant Turner vocals) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Flatt, Lester, 1914-1979; Ingram, Kenny; Martin, Benny; Hartford, John; Martin, Jimmy; Seckler, Curly, 1919-; Nashville Grass (Musical group); Tipton, Carl; Fairchild, Raymond;
